creator: jeff.holt@method-r.com
text:
Such debugging information are valuable in other contexts too.

I found a bug in 1.7.0 where a target wasn't getting apply'd because the dependset's was incorrectly identifying the "newest source".

So, here I argue two points:

First, the so-called Severity is not enhancement because it's debug code, not feature code. Debug code is buggy when: (1) it causes abnormal termination or (2) it fails to tell you what to do to fix your code. So, based upon this definition of buggy debug code, I would set the severity at least no less than "normal."

Second, even if you leave the Severity as "enhancement" you can still meet an earlier Target Milestone if you simply enumerate the list of files are when you render the "newest source" and the "oldest target file". Something like this:

FileResource "somefile" is the newest source of {"filea" [mtime], "fileb" [mtime],...}

Who cares if the list is long? The point of the debug information is to provide, well, information! How can you know what to do if you don't know upon what the decision was made?
